rdf:Description.dc:title: The Guardian's Cover Page on the Fall of the Berlin Wall: TEI Transcription
rdf:Description.dc:creator: Klara Chlupata
Andre Rodewald
Victor Villavicencio
rdf:Description.dc:subject: News, media, journalism, publishing (DDC 070)
rdf:Description.dc:description: The front page of print edition of British daily newspaper The Guardian dated November 10, 1989, featuring several articles dealing with the events in divided Germany that led to the fall of the Berlin Wall. In this object, the front page finds a digital remediation.
rdf:Description.dc:rights: This work is licensed under The Guardian's Open Licence. For detailed license conditions visit https://www.theguardian.com/info/2022/nov/01/open-licence-terms
rdf:Description.dc:source: Digital scan of the front page https://uploads.guim.co.uk/2019/10/28/10_Nov_89.jpg
